summary: This document is a set of 30-minute inmate check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019. The sheets are for multiple tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) and detail the required observation schedule for inmates in locked-down status, with signature columns for staff to document checks. The date is significant as it is the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.

events.title: SHU Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Routine 30-minute checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York were documented throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is dated August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody.
It details the 30-minute check protocol for inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), where Epstein was held.
The protocol required staff to observe each inmate at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
Sheets are provided for multiple tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M), indicating the scale of the monitoring operation.
The document is a standard prison operations form, showing the intended surveillance procedures in place.
